Plot shaded normal

Source: R/plot_shaded_normal.R
shaded_normal.Rd

plots a standard normal distribution, where a lower/upper part (2.5%, 97.5% per default) is filled with some other color

Usage

shaded_normal(
  xmin = -3,
  xmax = 3,
  threshold_min = -1.96,
  threshold_max = 1.96,
  color1 = "#E69F00",
  color2 = "#56B4E9",
  alpha_value = 0.9,
  breaks = c(threshold_min, threshold_max)
)

Arguments

xmin

min value of the the plotted normal (dbl)

xmax

max value of the the plotted normal (dbl)

threshold_min

lower threshold (default -1.96)

threshold_max

upper threshold (default 1.96)

color1

fill color of central part of the distribution (#E69F00)

color2

fill color of extremal part of the distribution (#56B4E9)

alpha_value

alpha of the fill (default .9)

Value

ggplot object

Examples

shaded_normal() + labs(x = "", y = "")
#> Error in ggplot(NULL, aes(c(xmin, xmax))): could not find function "ggplot"
shaded_normal(breaks = -3:3) + labs(x = "", y = "")
#> Error in ggplot(NULL, aes(c(xmin, xmax))): could not find function "ggplot"
shaded_normal(breaks = -3:3) +
  theme(panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank())
#> Error in ggplot(NULL, aes(c(xmin, xmax))): could not find function "ggplot"
